text: Krzysztof Krawczyk (born 28 January 1962 in Wałbrzych) is a Polish former high jumper. He represented his country at the 1988 Summer Olympics as well as one outdoor and two indoor World Championships. In addition he was the European Junior Champion in 1981. His personal bests in the event are 2.32 metres outdoors (Lublin 1988) and 2.30 metres indoors (Budapest 1987).All-Athletics profile ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1981 |European Indoor Championships |Grenoble, France |6th |2.19 m |- |European Junior Championships |Utrecht, Netherlands |bgcolor=gold|1st |2.26 m |- |1984 |European Indoor Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |12th |2.15 m |- |1985 |World Indoor Games |Paris, France |7th |2.21 m |- |rowspan=2|1986 |European Indoor Championships |Madrid, Spain |6th |2.24 m |- |European Championships |Stuttgart, West Germany |5th |2.28 m |- |rowspan=3|1987 |European Indoor Championships |Liévin, France |8th |2.24 m |- |Universiade |Zagreb, Yugoslavia |6th |2.24 m |- |World Championships |Rome, Italy |12th |2.24 m |- |1988 |Olympic Games |Seoul, South Korea |12th |2.31 m |- |1989 |World Indoor Championships |Budapest, Hungary |6th |2.28 m |} ==References== Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Polish male high jumpers Category:Olympic athletes of Poland Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:People from Wałbrzych Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Poland Category:Competitors at the 1987 Summer Universiade
title: Krzysztof Krawczyk (athlete)
